description: Like a true Parisian lady of fashion, La Ville de Paris usually dismisses the first insult from an opposing ship—but woe betide the foe who presumes to fires a second shot!

name: Lady Baptiste
ability: Once per turn, reroll any die roll made for this ship; you must use the second die roll result.
description: The beautiful Lady Baptiste, considered both a hero and a scourge, has even been asked by Madame LaFontaine to be one of her girls. Her allegiance remains true to her ship and crew.

name: Le  Marseillais
ability: When touching a Pirate ship, this ship may load as much of that ship's treasure as she can carry.
description: Chef Perier believes that garlic cures anything—even scurvy—so the crew of the jaunty Le Marseillais are known for the distinctive odor that rises as they sweat from loading treasure.

name: Le Bon Marin
ability: This ship may dock and explore a wild island using the same move action.
description: Phillipe Amqui once piloted Le Bon Marin through the bayou around New Orleans and into Jean Lafitte's hideout on a bet from Lady Baptiste.

name: Le Colibri
ability: L-range cannons cannot hit this ship.
description: Le Colibri flits about the sea just like her hummingbird namesake. Capitaine Arnaud, the Hag of Tortuga's godson, knows the currents and winds better than any other French-born captain in the fleet.

name: Le Courageux
ability: This ship ignores the first hit she takes each turn as long as she has all of her masts.
description: Guy LaPlante expertly captains Le Courageux; he makes sure the enemy can see his face, and know that both her guns and his sword are pointed at their heart.

name: Le Dauphin Royal
ability: This ship gets +1 to her cannon rolls against English ships.
description: Le Dauphin Royal carries both the name and the patronage of the royal family, and her loyal crew take seriously their responsibility of maintaining the honor of the nation.

name: Le Duc de Bourgogne
ability: This ship gets +1 to her cannon rolls against Pirate ships.
description: The crew of Le Duc de Bourgogne claim to have sunk more pirate ships than any other vessel on the Crimson Coast. Pirate captains everywhere yearn to sink the ship—with her crew tied to their own cannons.

name: Le Lyon
ability: Schooner. This ship gets +1 to her boarding rolls.
description: Le Lyon sailed out of Quebec, raiding English and American ports all along the Atlantic Coast. She remained successful to New Orleans; a new crew will make the return trip.

name: Le Mercure
ability: Schooner. This ship cannot be pinned.
description: Le Mercure has mastered the art of evasion, moving through enemy lines as though she were wearing the winged shoes of the messenger of the gods himself.

name: Le Pique
ability: You may double the range of this ship's cannons each turn, but you must roll a 6  to hit.
description: Guy Laplante retrieved this ship from the English and returned it to France. It’s guns were upgraded by its English captors, and the current crew is learning how to fire them effectively.

name: Le Requin
ability: Once per turn before you give this ship an action, roll a d6. On a 5 or 6, this ship may be given the same action twice.
description: The mannerisms, language facility, and learned nature of the dashing Le Requin hint at a previous life of privilege. Le Requin won his first ship from Bones Wiley in a dice game, and he has proven himself a brilliant tactician and natural leader. He is on a collision course with Hawkins over the affections of the Lady De Sol.

name: Le Soleil Royal
ability: Once per turn when this ship hits an enemy ship, also eliminate one crew from that ship.
description: Capitain DeZay has assigned each of his cannonneers a specific color of cannonball, so that they get the credit they deserve in battle.

name: Le Solitaire
ability: Friendly ships within S of this ship get +1 to their cannon rolls.
description: France's allies are gladdened upon seeing Le Solitaire, for it means the powerful fleet is nearby. The little scout benefits from both good sailing and intelligence gained from Maurice Aristide's spy network.

name: Le St. Michel
ability: This ship gets +1 to her boarding rolls.
description: As feared as the ship is, her meticulously dressed—yet ferocious—crew is even more reviled. For a drink, The Stump will tell stories about atrocities committed "in defense of France."

name: Le Superbe
ability: Other ships do not block this ship's line of fire.
description: The women of France cried the day their men sailed on Le Superbe. They knew they had lost them forever, for no woman could live up to such a perfect vessel.

name: Le Triton
ability: Schooner. This ship cannot be pinned.
description: In combat, a member of Le Triton's crew blows the battle call on a huge conch shell to inspire the men. Geoffrey Flores covets her and the seemingly magical seashell as trophies.

name: Letter of Marque
ability: Your ship may dock at an enemy home island and be given repair actions (only) while there. Forts cannot fire on this ship unless this ship fires on them first.

name: Lightning
ability: Schooner.
description: The Lightning was commissioned by the Americans to patrol the North Atlantic. Unfortunately for them, Captain Wright didn’t like his pay, and now uses the ship as a way to collect a higher wage.

name: Longshanks
ability: This ship may never load the last treasure from an island.
description: Although they are excellent gunners, the crew of the Longshanks do not coordinate well on any other tasks, including the gathering of treasure.

name: Louisiana
ability: Schooner. Once per turn when this ship hits an enemy ship, also eliminate one crew from that ship.
description: Captain Anson, once a French privateer, has taught his crew to spot and aim for the weakest points in an enemy ship, in order to do the most damage.

name: Lt. Nigel Hardwicke
ability: Marine. This crew gets +1 to its gun rolls against American ships, forts, and crew.
description: A veteran of the European wars, Hardwicke uses his land-based skills at sea to crush the American revolutionaries. He believes he will be the one to plant the Union Jack in Philadelphia.

name: Lucky the Parrot
ability: Once per turn, this ship may look at one face-down cargo on any ship.
description: Bones often has Lucky fly to a ship to see what she holds. When Lucky returns, it uses its claws to "roll" dice into a stein, determining if the ship will be spared or pursued. Potential victims know that to shoot at Lucky would result in Wiley killing them and everyone they've ever met, so they leave their fate to the dice.

name: Lynch's Noose
ability: This ship gets +1 to her boarding rolls.
description: The Noose is a special unit of the King's Marines that specializes in the bloody business of boarding actions. These men are the most loyal to Governor Lynch and his quest to rid the Caribbean of pirates.

name: Lynx
ability: When this ship carries no cargo, she gets +S to her base move.
description: Once a ship sailing with Don Perdo, the Lynx was one of the first ships captured on Porter’s watch.

name: Madame LaFontaine
ability: Limit, Ransom. Choose one French crew during setup; this crew is linked to that crew. Reroll any die roll, you must use the second result.
description: Madame LaFontaine is proprietress of Chateau Fontainebleu, a burlesque house in New Orleans. Her girls report everything they hear to Madame, and she passes that information to Amiral Dupuy.

name: Marksman's Map
ability: Once per turn, this ship may look at one face-down cargo on any island.

name: Master Bianco
ability: This ship gets +1 cargo spaces. This crew takes up no cargo space.
description: This quiet, unassuming man is in demand for his unrivaled cargo-packing efficiency. But only Capitàn Castro knows that Bianco always packs away something extra for himself. Bianco knows that Castro will one day require payment for his secrecy.

name: Master Gunner Rogelio Vazquez
ability: All of this ship's cannons have L range.
description: Vazquez can hit a wine glass with a cannonball at 500 yards. He secretly desires to own a weapon made by the master himself, Charles Southwyn, so he searches through every treasure haul, looking for items made by the English legend.

name: Matthias Vospero
ability: This ship gets +1 to her cannon rolls against English ships.
description: Capitán Raphael Vospero has taken a vow to avenge his brother, whose ship was sunk by the HMS Viceroy. Vospero uses his access to naval intelligence reports to mask his quest as service to the Crown.

name: Maurice Aristide
ability: One of this ship's treasures is worth +2 gold when unloaded at your home island.
description: Hiding behind a ridiculous facade of heavy court makeup and a high wig, Maurice Aristide appears every bit the foppishly perfumed and helpless French courtier. In truth, he is a brilliant businessman with the knowledge both to find treasure on the Crimson Coast and to traffic it safely to his European accounts.

name: Mermaids
ability: Reveal this event at the beginning of one of your turns and place its token on a non-docked enemy ship. That ship may not be given an action for a number of turns equal to the number of crew on her when Mermaids was revealed. After those turns have elapsed, remove Mermaids from the game.

name: Mermaids
ability: Reveal this event at the beginning of one of your turns and place its token on a non-docked enemy ship. That ship may not be given an action for a number of turns equal to the number of crew on her when Mermaids was revealed. After those turns have elapsed, remove Mermaids from the game.

name: Mermaid
ability: This ship cannot carry crew.
description: A tiny vessel with few crew, the Mermaid is the ideal bait for greedy vessels. A favorite tactic is to have the captain's sister, Maud, masquerade as a captured noblewoman.

name: Michel Bordeaux
ability: Marine. This crew gets +1 to its gun rolls against English ships, forts, and crew.
description: At Viscomtesse Richelieu’s request, Bordeaux’s task is to shore up the defenses of France's New World holdings. He feels obligated to protect her holdings first, then hunt down the English.

name: Missionary
ability: Remove all crew on this ship from the game and then remove Missionary from the game.

name: Monsieur LeNoir
ability: Once per turn, one crew or ship within S of this ship cannot use its ability that turn.
description: Despite rumors of nobility, Monsieur LeNoir prefers to cultivate a quiet and understated persona. Although never at the forefront of events, some speculate that he orchestrates them anyway, as he has ties to almost everyone.  Always dressed impeccably in black, he has many lady admirers, who find his dark good looks deliciously menacing.

name: Muerta de la Corona
ability: This ship gets +1 to her cannon rolls against Spanish ships.
description: "Death to the Crown" was so named by Gaspar Zuan to appease his brother's bloodlust for the throne of Spain.

name: Musketeer
ability: This ship gains one 3S cannon that may not have its range or cannon roll increased. It can shoot from any mast (even an eliminated mast).

name: Musketeer
ability: This ship gains one 3S cannon that may not have its range or cannon roll increased. It can shoot from any mast (even an eliminated mast).

name: Musketeer
ability: This ship gains one 3S cannon that may not have its range or cannon roll increased. It can shoot from any mast (even an eliminated mast).

name: Musketeer
ability: This ship gains one 3S cannon that may not have its range or cannon roll increased. It can shoot from any mast (even an eliminated mast).

name: Musketeer
ability: This ship gains one 3S cannon that may not have its range or cannon roll increased. It can shoot from any mast (even an eliminated mast).

name: Musketeer
ability: This ship gains one 3S cannon that may not have its range or cannon roll increased. It can shoot from any mast (even an eliminated mast).

name: Musketeer
ability: This ship gains one 3S cannon that may not have its range or cannon roll increased. It can shoot from any mast (even an eliminated mast).

name: Musketeer
ability: This ship gains one S range rank-3 cannon that may not have its range or cannon roll increased. It can shoot from any mast (even an eliminated mast).

name: Myngs Marauders
ability: Other ships do not block this ship's line of fire.
description: Myngs' most-trusted men have been with him since he was captain of the 52-gun Marston Moor. They are well trained and have deadly aim.

name: Natives
ability: The ship that reveals Natives may not be given actions for a number of rounds equal to number of crew on her when Natives is revealed. Leave Natives face down on its island.

name: Nemesio Diaz
ability: Once per turn, cancel the ability of one crew or ship within S of this ship.
description: Nemesio Diaz (aka William Cob, Jean Parisot la Valette, and Michel van Horn) is a true son of Spain, but he spends most of his time spying on the aristocracy of Spain's enemies. He works to defeat any who would plunder the riches that are Spain's by papal decree; that is, all of the Americas.

name: Neptune's Figurehead
ability: If this ship sinks, dock it fully repaired at its home island, then remove Neptune's Figurehead from the game.

name: Neptune's Hoard
ability: Schooner. After looking at treasure on a wild island, you may trade any one treasure from that island for a random treasure on any other wild island. This ship must load the traded treasure.
description: The crew of Neptune's Hoard has mastered the fine art of negotiating the best price for their goods—then sacking the towns that can't, or won’t, meet their demands.

name: Neptune's Trident
ability: Give this ship a shoot action. A wave S wide and 3 L long leaves the ship in one direction. Up to 2 masts or cannons of every ship and fort in the path of the wave are eliminated. Eliminate one of this ship's masts for every affected ship and fort. Remove Neptune's Trident from the game.

name: Oarsman
ability: If derelict, this ship gains a base move of S. This crew takes up no cargo space.

name: Oarsman
ability: If derelict, this ship gains a base move of S. This crew takes up no cargo space.

name: Oarsman
ability: If derelict, this ship gains a base move of S. This crew takes up no cargo space.

name: Oarsman
ability: If derelict, this ship gains a base move of S. This crew takes up no cargo space.

name: Oarsmen
ability: If derelict, this ship gains a base move of S. This crew takes up no cargo space.

name: Panda
ability: Schooner. When this ship hits an enemy ship, you may also eliminate one cargo from that ship.
description: The Panda, under the command of "Don" Pedro, prefers the easy prey of ships damaged in battle or by storms, attacking as they limp back to port.

name: Pandora
ability: This ship gets +1 to her boarding rolls.
description: Mastered by the mysterious and beautiful Crimson Angel, the Pandora spreads death and destruction. Unlike the evils spread by the mythological relic, however, Crimson Angel's plunderings are capricious: Some ships suffer only theft, while others are wiped out.

name: Paradis de la Mer
ability: The first time this fort is shot at each turn, roll a d6. The result is the number of times this fort must be hit that turn before any of its cannons can be eliminated.
description: The Paradise of the Sea is now home to second-generation French settlers, who will fight to the death to keep their island safe from outsiders.

name: Peacock
ability: Schooner. This ship cannot be pinned.
description: Jean Lafitte has tried to steal and capture the Peacock. Now he’s been reduced to trying to buy the ship to gain her advantage in tight battles.

name: Pescados de Plata
ability: Once per turn, this ship may move S after unloading cargo.
description: The "Silver Fish" is fast and agile. Her crews are all ex-merchant sailors, and so they are expert cargo handlers

name: Philadelphia
ability: You own any derelict this ship explores; both ships become docked at your home island.
description: A familiar sight near New Orleans is Ruth Lee at the helm of the Philadelphia, with a derelict pirate ship in tow.

name: Phillipe Amqui
ability: This ship ignores terrain when she is given a move action (islands are not terrain).
description: Amqui claims that Native Americans taught him how to talk to the water. His uncanny ability to accurately read the sea has made him worth his weight in gold.

name: Phillipe du Brissac
ability: Place this crew face up during setup. Reduce the cost of all other crew placed on this ship by 1.
description: Phillipe du Brissac makes a living luring ambitious men into the French navy, promising to introduce them to those with influence and power. By the time they see through his charade, they are out to sea, though it's only a matter of time before someone exposes him for the poseur he is. Fortunately, he is partially sheltered by his good friend, Maurice Aristide.

name: Phillipe Laffite
ability: When this ship hits another ship, you choose which mast is eliminated.
description: Though his brother gets the fame, Phillipe is a crack shot with a cannon and has trained many cannonneers. He is responsible for the devastating attacks the Pride can unleash.

name: Plague
ability: All crew on this ship are removed. When this ship touches any other ship,  pass this treasure to that ship and the crew on that ship are now removed. While in possesion of the scurvy treasure this ship cannot dock.

name: Powder Pete
ability: One of this ship's treasures is worth +1 gold when she docks at your home island.
description: Pete is Carbon Charlie's right-hand man—mostly because he caused Charlie to lose his right arm! Powder Pete knows how to turn cannons into gold and, when they have it, gold into more gold.

name: Pride
ability: Schooner. Broadsides Attack.
description: At a distance, the Pride appears to be ideal for smuggling and making swift attacks. But if she comes alongside, concentrated fire from her cannons is the last thing a crew will see.

name: Raft
ability: You may reveal Raft immediately after one of your ships sinks. Place all crew and gold on that ship onto the nearest wild island. Remove Raft from the game.

name: Raft
ability: You may reveal Raft immediately after one of your ships sinks. Place all crew and gold on that ship onto the nearest wild island. Remove Raft from the game.

name: Ralph David
ability: One of this ship's treasures is worth +2 gold when unloaded at your home island.
description: The David family is said to own Charleston, and Ralph has used his family’s power and prestige to achieve his goal of owning the shipping lanes to the Crimson Coast as well.

name: Ramsgate
ability: This fort has one 2 L-range cannon. When placing this fort, indicate this cannon by placing two flags side by side.
description: The first fort that Rogers commissioned boldly declares this message: "This land and the sea around it belong to the English Crown."

name: Ranger
ability: Broadsides Attack
description: Brother Virgil inspired the crew of the Ranger to become seagoing Robin Hoods —with themselves as the deserving poor! Captain Greene intends to repay Brother Virgil for his "spiritual guidance."

name: Rattlesnake
ability: English ships get +1 to their cannon rolls against this ship.
description: Originally an English ship, the Rattlesnake's American crew mutinied and forced the English officers into a rowboat. In response, Woodes Rogers issued a general order to sink the Rattlesnake.

name: Raven's Neck
ability: Once per turn, this ship may look at one face-down treasure on any island.
description: The tall crows nests of the Raven's Neck provide excellent vantage points for the spotting of treasure and targets.

name: Raven
ability: Schooner. This ship cannot be pinned.
description: Captain Parrish, a man of visions, says that Branwen the White Raven protects the ship, deflecting enemy fire with her invisible wings. His claim to fame: once drinking Jack Hawkins under the table.

name: Revenant
ability: Other ships do not block this ship's line of fire.
description: The Revenant ("one who returns after death") is an appropriate name for the mysterious flagship of Capitan El Fantasma and his ghostly crew.

name: Revenant
ability: Other ships do not block this ship's line of fire.
description: Sailing out of the mist on moonless nights, the sight of the ghostly Revenant and the agonizing howls of El Fantasma and his inhuman crew have caused many ships to surrender without a shot being fired.

name: Revenge
ability: This ship gets +1 to her cannon rolls against English ships.
description: The Revenge was known as HMS Sedgewick before she was liberated by Genny Gallows, who gave the ship a new purpose: sending the English to their maker.

name: Roanoke
ability: Pirate crew may use their abilities on this ship.
description: The Roanoke is a mystery, vanishing and reappearing seemingly at will. Captain Morris and his crew, including a Powhatan-native navigator, however, are not related to the true ghost ships of the Crimson Coast.

name: Robinson
ability: Always place this crew face up; it cannot be eliminated unless its ship sinks. Crew placed on this ship cost no points, but they always each take up one cargo space. When this ship is hit, roll a d6. On a result of 5 or 6, move the crew on this ship with the highest point cost to a wild island chosen by the player to your left.
description: Found on an uncharted island, Robinson can't remember the name of his ship, its fate, or the reason he was left behind. Woe betide the crew that rescues him!

name: Rover
ability: This ship’s base move becomes S when she reaches her cargo limit.
description: Captain Hansson has made maps of many of the small inlets that litter the Crimson Coast, which he uses as refuge when his ship's small hold becomes laden with treasure.

name: Royal Fortune
ability: Spanish crew may use their abilities on this ship.
description: The Royal Fortune seeks to deliver what her name implies. Manned by both buccaneers and ex-Spanish sailors, she preys on the royal fleets of all nations.

name: Royal James
ability: Schooner. Once per turn when this ship hits an enemy ship, also eliminate one crew from that ship.
description: An ongoing competition aboard the Royal James gives bonuses for firing efficiency. One-shot kills are especially prized, and golden guineas are doubled for Spanish targets.

name: Rum
ability: Do not give this ship an action the turn after loading rum.  Rum is worth gold equal to 6 minus the number of crew aboard this ship when rum was loaded.

name: Ruth Lee
ability: Place this crew face up during setup. Reduce the cost of all other crew placed on this ship by 1.
description: Born and raised at sea and respected by everyone, even pirates, she has forgotten more about ships, sailors and the sea than most of the so-called professionals have ever known.

name: Santiago
ability: When this ship hits an enemy ship, you may also eliminate one cargo from that ship.
description: Captain Alberto Ladron could care less about collecting cargo. All he cares about is refitting captured prizes so that they are worthy of a conquering hero of Spain.

name: Saratoga
ability: Schooner. This ship gets +1 to her boarding rolls.
description: Captain Oswald "recruited" his crew from the Baltimore jailhouse and gave them one law: when you hit the deck of the enemy ship, the survivor goes home a free man.

name: Scepter
ability: Friendly ships within S of this ship get +1 to their cannon rolls.
description: First Mate William Houston has taught the crew a special code using flags and lights, allowing them to safely and quickly relay information to the main ship—usually about likely prey.

name: Scrye the Explorer
ability: This ship may dock and explore a wild island using the same move action.

name: Scurvy
ability: Roll a d6 at the beginning of each of your turns. On results of 4–6, eliminate a crew on this ship. Remove Scurvy from the game when this ship docks at her home island.

name: Sea Nymph
ability: If derelict, this ship gains a base move of S.
description: After Captain Jack Hawkins was "asked" to leave the Ballista, he worked his way back to prominence by taking the El Gama Larga, which he renamed the Sea Nymph as an insult to his former crew.

name: Sextant
ability: This ship ignores terrain when given move actions (islands are not terrain).

name: Shadow
ability: This ship may dock at an enemy home island and load one treasure. If able, she must leave on your next turn.
description: Taking the El Aquilino—now renamed the Shadow—launched Calico Cat into prominence. How she managed to take such a large ship is still a mystery, but the Cat now has more firepower in her quest for revenge.

name: Shipping Charts
ability: Once per turn, this ship may look at one face-down cargo on any ship.

name: Shipwright
ability: This ship may repair at sea or at any island.

name: Shipwright
ability: This ship may repair at sea or at any island.

name: Shipwright
ability: This ship may repair at sea or at any island.

name: Shipwright
ability: This ship may repair at sea or at any island.

name: Shipwright
ability: This ship may repair at sea or at any island.

name: Shipwright
ability: This ship may repair at sea or at any island.

name: Shipwright
ability: This ship may repair at sea or at any island.

name: Shipwright
ability: This ship may repair at sea or at any island.

name: Shipwright
ability: This ship may repair at sea or at any island.

name: Shipwright
ability: This ship may repair at sea or at any island.

name: Silver Dagger
ability: This ship gets +L to her base move if she has all of her masts
description: The Silver Dagger was taken from the Dutch near the island of St. Barts. She is swift when undamaged, but slothful when wounded. To prevent being slowed, she has excellent cannons stolen from the Spanish

name: Silverback
ability: L range cannons cannot hit this ship.
description: Captain Luc de Card won the Silverback in a card game. Ironically, he later lost the French warship when he bet three kings against a full house. He remarked ruefully that he should have known better than to depend on kings, of all people.

name: Sir Christopher Myngs
ability: Once per turn before you give this ship an action, roll a d6. On a 5 or 6, this ship may be given the same action twice.
description: Myngs was sent to the Spanish Main to remove the Spanish. As usual, however, he wasn't given enough ships to do the job, so he pioneered the English-buccaneer fleet. He personally led the largest of these fleets against the Spanish and Dutch.

name: Sir Watkins Defoe
ability: This ship ignores terrain when she is given a move action (islands are not terrain).
description: Sir Watkins spends so much time aboard his ship that he is uncomfortable on land. He reads the sea as easily as a mother understands the cries of her baby.

name: Skyme the Monkey
ability: Once per turn, this ship may randomly take one treasure from any ship she touches.
description: Lady Arcadia de Sol gifted this monkey to Jack after he saved her from Blackheart. Jack renamed him Skyme in honor of his old partner, but wishes that he hadn't: The monkey seems to have picked up some of Blackheart's more evil mannerisms.

name: Snipe
ability: L range cannons cannot hit this ship.
description: The Snipe is a fast and agile sloop whose speed is her best defense. Jack Hawkins used the Snipe to capture the Sea Nymph.

name: Snipe
ability: L range cannons cannot hit this ship.
description: The Snipe fell prey to the Revenant and became part of the ghost fleet until liberated by Jack Hawkins, who had other plans for her.

name: Star of Siam
description: The Star of Siam had just raided an American ship leaving the Barbary Coast for the Americas when Wesley captured her, claiming the ship and her swollen cargo holds for himself.

name: Stinkpot Cannoneer
ability: Once per turn when this ship is given a shoot action, one of her cannons may shoot a stinkpot at a target within S. You must declare which cannon will shoot the stinkpot before rolling the d6. If the stinkpot hits, do not eliminate a mast; instead, the target's crew cannot use their abilities next turn.

name: Stinkpot Cannoneer
ability: Once per turn when this ship is given a shoot action, one of her cannons may shoot a stinkpot at a target within S. You must declare which cannon will shoot the stinkpot before rolling the d6. If the stinkpot hits, do not eliminate a mast; instead, the target's crew cannot use their abilities next turn.

name: Stinkpot Cannoneer
ability: Once per turn when this ship is given a shoot action, one of her cannons may shoot a stinkpot at a target within S. You must declare which cannon will shoot the stinkpot before rolling the d6. If the stinkpot hits, do not eliminate a mast; instead, the target's crew cannot use their abilities next turn.

name: Stinkpot Cannoneer
ability: Once per turn when this ship is given a shoot action, one of her cannons may shoot a stinkpot at a target within S. You must declare which cannon will shoot the stinkpot before rolling the d6. If the stinkpot hits, do not eliminate a mast; instead, the target's crew cannot use their abilities next turn.

name: Stinkpot Specialist
ability: Once per turn when this ship is given a shoot action, one of her cannons may shoot a stinkpot at a target within S. You must declare which cannon will shoot the stinkpot before rolling the d6. If the stinkpot hits, do not eliminate a mast; instead, the target's crew cannot use their abilities next turn.

name: Stinkpot Specialist
ability: Once per turn when this ship is given a shoot action, one of her cannons may shoot a stinkpot at a target within S. You must declare which cannon will shoot the stinkpot before rolling the d6. If the stinkpot hits, do not eliminate a mast; instead, the target's crew cannot use their abilities next turn.

name: Stinkpot Specialist
ability: Once per turn when this ship is given a shoot action, one of her cannons may shoot a stinkpot at a target within S. You must declare which cannon will shoot the stinkpot before rolling the d6. If the stinkpot hits, do not eliminate a mast; instead, the target's crew cannot use their abilities next turn.

name: Stinkpot Specialist
ability: Once per turn when this ship is given a shoot action, one of her cannons may shoot a stinkpot at a target within S. You must declare which cannon will shoot the stinkpot before rolling the d6. If the stinkpot hits, do not eliminate a mast; instead, the target's crew cannot use their abilities next turn.

name: Stinkpot Specialist
ability: Once per turn when this ship is given a shoot action, one of her cannons may shoot a stinkpot at a target within S of her. You must declare which cannon will shoot the stinkpot before rolling the d6. If the stinkpot hits, do not eliminate a mast; instead, the target's crew cannot use their abilities next turn.

name: St. Pierre
ability: If a ship docks at this fort and unloads at least 4 gold, it may be given a second action that turn.
description: Informed captains know that when they dock at the port of St. Pierre, a little extra gold ensures that their cargo will be unloaded swiftly—and without a lot of questions.

name: The Darkhawk II
ability: This ship's base move becomes S when she reaches her cargo limit.
description: The El Pàjaro Relleno was Master Bianco's favorite ship before she was captured. He once said, "Given time, I could hide most of Spain in her enormous hold."

name: The Devil's Maw
ability: Place your eliminated crew on this fort. They gain the Ghost Ship keyword.
description: Rumors say that The Devils' Maw holds a king’s ransom in gold, but you must give up your soul to claim it--a price even pirates hesitate to pay.

name: The Flying Fish
ability: Schooner. This ship gets +1 to her cannon rolls against Pirate ships.
description: Originally part of Ralph David's privateer fleet, the Flying Fish was given to Porter so that experienced pirate hunters could teach his sailors the ins and outs of the pirate mind.

name: The Hag of Tortuga
ability: Limit. Ransom. Place this crew face up during setup. You may build your fleet using 5 more points than the game's build total. This crew cannot leave this ship unless captured or eliminated.
description: Creole Amelie Lejeune, better known as the "Hag of Tortuga" is a sea crone feared and respected by all the sailors on the Crimson Coast, regardless of nationality. It is said that she can commune with the dead, control the winds, and stop a man dead in his tracks with just a glance.

name: The Patch
ability: This ship ignores terrain when she is given a move action (islands are not terrain).
description: How he lost his eye is a mystery, but rumors persist that he sold it to the Devil in exchange for the ability to see the shoals and reefs hidden bneath treacherous waters.

name: The Recreant
ability: Once per turn when this ship hits an enemy ship, also eliminate one crew from that ship.
description: Sailed by a crew of buccaneers who became sharpshooters while hunting illegal game, the Recreant prefers to first eliminate enemy officers in a fight to reduce her prey's effectiveness.

name: The Stump
ability: Place this crew face up during setup. Reduce the cost of all other crew placed on this ship by 1.
description: No one knows how The Stump got his peg leg, but most are happy to buy him as many rounds as it takes to hear the latest version of the tale. He's an excellent source of gossip about the latest goings-on around the Crimson Coast, and he might even know something about the "Eye of the Dragon"—or so he says.

name: Thomas Gunn the Elder
ability: This ship gets +1 to her cannon rolls against Spanish ships.
description: Gunn's family was sailing to Jamaica when the Spanish warship El Tirãn attacked. His wife was killed, and Capitàn de Alva took Gunn's 18-year-old daughter, Catherine, hostage. Gunn sold his soul to the navy for ransom money, but Spain denies any knowledge of her.

name: Thomas Gunn the Younger
ability: This ship may move and shoot using the same move action, plus. Once per turn when this ship hits an enemy ship, also eliminate one crew from that ship.
description: Gunn became a marine in His Majesty's Navy to seek revenge on the Spanish for his mother's death and sister's abduction, and he becomes more convinced every day that pirates deserve to die. His marksmanship is famous on the Main, as is his pension for keeping to himself.

name: Thompson's Island
ability: This fort gets +1 to its cannon rolls when a ship is docked at it.
description: As the westernmost island in a string of dangerous, rocky atolls, controlling Thompson's Island is the key to controlling the Crimson Coast.

name: Tiger
ability: This ship's cannons may not be eliminated (masts still may be). If derelict, she cannot shoot.
description: Stolen from the Spanish, the Tiger is the prize of Captain Vivas who uses the little blockade runner to sack Spanish holdings along the Crimson Coast.

name: Treachery
ability: English ships get +1 to their cannon rolls against this ship.
description: The Treachery earned her name and the eternal hatred of Her Majesty's Navy when she "guided" the fleet over a reef that splintered their hulls. Her crew later returned and looted the wrecked ships.

name: Treasure
ability: Schooner. Forts cannot hit this ship.
description: Some say that naming a pirate ship "the Treasure" is asking for trouble, but Captain Prentiss isn't worried: The ship's goods are stored in a warehouse in Lucina Harbor—not in her hold.

name: Trees
ability: Trees may remain face-down on its island if the ship that explores that island has all of its masts. When Trees is revealed, fully repair this ship, and then remove Trees from the game.

name: United States
ability: Broadsides Attack.
description: The "Old War Wagon" is the slowest ship in the American navy, but when she catches you in her devastating guns, speed doesn’t matter.

name: Venture
ability: This ship sinks when her last mast is eliminated.
description: Nothing ventured, nothing gained. The Venture carries more gunpowder than she should in order to double pack her guns for better range. But that makes her a potential fireworks display.

name: Vicomte Jules de Cissey
ability: Limit. Ransom. Place this crew face up during setup. You may build your fleet using 5 more points than the game's build total. This crew cannot leave this ship unless captured or eliminated.
description: Not everyone who wears a fancy uniform deserves it—especially not Vicomte Jules de Cissey. Every inch the powdered puppy, his shrill demands and pretentious behavior make him generally disliked by all who meet him. He is, however, a vicomte with means, so he continues to receive his social due, though his presence adds no luster to events.

name: Vicomtesse Angelique de Richelieu
ability: Once per turn, this ship may randomly take one treasure from any ship she touches.
description: Vicomtesse Angelique de Richelieu's exquisite beauty belies a dangerously cunning mind. Clever and well-connected, she has established an intricate spy network whose tentacles reach all the way back to France. It is not known whether her relationship with the shadowy Monsieur LeNoir is romantic or professional, but it's safer not to inquire.

name: Wasp
ability: Schooner. Once per turn, this ship may move S after loading treasure.
description: Ever-changing alliances  taught the Wasp's crew to unload their goods quickly and move out before they were declared an "unfriendly presence" in port.

name: Weapons
ability: This ship gets +1 to her boarding rolls for every crew on her.

name: Wesley
ability: As part of a move action, this ship may initiate a boarding party against a ship within S of her, without having to ram.  The boarded ship may not use any boaring bonuses she may have.
description: As an English privateer, Wesley raided ships and ports along the Barbary Coast. But a chance meeting with Jack Hawkins in Tangier convinced Wesley that he was fighitng on the wrong side.

name: Windjammer
ability: Forts cannot shoot at this ship.
description: The Windjammer's nimble nature makes her a tough target, but at the cost of reduced firepower.

name: Woodes Rogers
ability: This ship gets +1 to her cannon rolls against forts within S of her. This ship gets +1 to her cannon rolls against Pirate ships.
description: Few know that Rogers began his career as a privateer under the English flag. His new status angers the French and Spanish—his former victims—and earns him the begrudging respect of the pirates.

name: Yankee
ability: Schooner. This ship cannot be pinned.
description: The captain of the Yankee sailed her into the middle of a formation of three English ships and maneuvered so quickly that the enemy ships rammed each other. Score: Yankee 3, English 0.

name: Zephyr
ability: This ship gets +1 to her boarding rolls.
description: The Zephyr was the sloop that Calico Cat stole from Havana. Her crew is made up of the most deadly fighters Havana's slums have ever produced.

name: Admiral Morgan
ability: Once per turn, roll a d6. On a 5 or 6, this ship may be given an extra action
description: Henry Morgan was once a feared buccaneer. Sailing under letters of marque from Sir Myngs and Governor Modyford, he became wealthy by sacking Spanish Caribbean towns. Governor Lynch sent him to England to stand trial for his crimes, but instead he was knighted and made admiral of all the English fleets on the Spanish Main.

name: Almirante Devante del Nero
ability: This ship gets +1 to her cannon rolls against Pirate ships.
description: Almirante del Nero, commander of the Armada de Barlavento, is a man driven almost mad by his zeal to rid the Spanish Main of pirates. To fail will be to fail his duty to God. His vision is so singular that he even secretly corresponds with his nation's enemy, Governor Lynch of Jamaica.

name: Asesino de la Nave
ability: When this ship hits an enemy ship, you may also eliminate one cargo from that ship.
description: The "Ship Killer" is armed with huge bore cannons capable of devastating short-range damage. Capitan Gonzalo Mora first rose to prominence on her deck.

name: Batavian Bat
ability: L range cannons cannot hit this ship.
description: Narrow of beam and light of sail, the Batavian Bat is very nimble, but not fantastically fast. She prefers to engage from long range, making her a tough target.

name: Bianco's Haulers
ability: This ship may unload cargo at your home island if she's within S of it.
description: Master Bianco has a small fleet that shuttles his secret stores from the ships in the middle of the night. The strong backs and iron arms of his Haulers help to move the cargo quickly by rowboat and to defend it from curious eyes and meddling hands.

name: Bonny Kate
ability: English crew may use their abilities on this ship
description: The Bonny Kate is a welcoming berth to any British lad who will take an oath against all kings.

name: Brother Virgil
ability: Crew of any nationality may use their abilities on this ship.
description: Brother Virgil has been a spiritual guide to island natives for many years. No one knows exactly which holy order he belongs to, but it apparently does not require a vow of poverty: The affable monk has grown rich from "gifts" received for placing crew on ships.

name: Calico Cat
ability: Once per turn before you give this ship an action, roll a d6. On a 5 or 6, this ship may be given the same action twice.
description: Calico Cat (real name rumored to be Catherine) got her start only recently by stealing a Spanish sloop from Havana. She leads her crew with a dazzling smile that belies her deadly determination. Her anonymous past cannot hide her suffering, and she intends to make the crowns of Europe suffer as well.

name: Cannoneer
ability: Once per turn, one of this ship's cannons may shoot again if it misses.

name: Cannoneer
ability: Once per turn, one of this ship's cannons may shoot again if it misses.

name: Cannoneer
ability: Once per turn, one of this ship's cannons may shoot again if it misses.

name: Capitan Alarico Castro
ability: Once per turn before you give this ship an action, roll a d6. On a 5 or 6, this ship may be given the same action twice.
description: Castro is a dedicated man, but ultimately not to Spain. He  "overcame" his Moorish heritage to rise to the top of the Spanish Navy, but he plots against every Castilian who has wronged him. Castro does his duty, but he patiently waits to make his move.

name: Captain Blackheart
ability: This ship may move and shoot using the same move action. Once per turn, you may eliminate one of this ship's crew to give her an extra action.
description: Angus Skyme came to the Spanish Main in the brig of HMS Prudence. He escaped the gallows and gathered the roughest crew in the Caribbean. Blackheart shows no quarter to his victims or crew, and he has killed many of both for his amusement and profit. He still bears the scar from the duel he fought with Hawkins over Lady Arcadia de Sol.

name: Captain Jack Hawkins
ability: This ship may move and shoot using the same move action.  On the turn this ship is pinned, eliminate one crew from the enemy ship.
description: Hawkins was an expert marksman and poacher until he was caught and shipped to Port Royal as an indentured servant. Blackheart liberated Hawkins when he sacked Port Royal, and the pair was dynamic until a dispute over Lady Arcadia de Sol. Hawkins won the girl, but also a powerful enemy.

name: Captain
ability: This ship may move and shoot using the same move action.

name: Captain
ability: This ship may move and shoot using the same move action.

name: Captain
ability: This ship may move and shoot using the same move action.

name: Carbon Charlie
ability: When this ship is docked at your home island, you may eliminate one treasure. It becomes a  3S cannon that can be eliminated only when the ship sinks.
description: Always covered in soot from his forge, "Carbon Charlie" makes some of the finest firearms in the world. His crowning achievement—the secret of which he will likely take to the grave—is the world's largest cannon.

name: Carrion Crow
ability: Eliminate one of this ship's masts when she rolls a 1 on any cannon roll.
description: The Carrion Crow has not had the best of luck recently, as Fernando Sanchez has twice attacked and damaged her. The result is that the ship has no money and is becoming run down.

name: Castro's Loyalists
ability: This ship gets +1 to her boarding rolls.
description: Over the years, Capitàn Castro has surrounded himself with loyal crew. They are hardened men who fight well and don't question their orders, and Castro is betting on that when the time comes to change flags.

name: Cazador del pirata
ability: This ship gets +1 to her cannon rolls against Pirate ships.
description: The crew of the "Pirate Hunter" was literally whipped into shape by the obsessive Almirante Devante del Nero. He ensured that the only thing they hated more than him was pirates.

name: Comandante Antonio de Silva
ability: Once per turn when this ship hits an enemy ship, also eliminate one crew from that ship.
description: As a King's Marine, de Silva was once one of Spain's top musketeers. When he lost his right eye to a grape-shot volley fired by Christopher Myngs' ship, he feared for his career. But he learned to shoot all over again, vowing revenge on Myngs, his pirates, and all English.

name: Comandante Luys de Alva
ability: This ship gets +1 to her cannon rolls against English ships.
description: Some say that de Alva's influential parents are the reason for his rapid climb in the Spanish Navy; these people do not know de Alva. His singular vision is to rid the Spanish Main of foreign holdings, starting with the English and the pirates they sponsor. De Alva's biggest weakness is becoming too "involved" with his "prizes."

name: Commodore Temple
ability: You own any derelict this ship explores; both ships become docked at your home island.
description: Temple is the second son of an English nobleman in Ireland. Many say that his success has been greased with the blood of men he throws into hopeless situations and deadly boarding actions. His only weakness is his infatuation with the lovely Countess Doone.

name: Countess Diana Doone
ability: Place this crew face up during setup. Reduce the cost of all other crew placed on this ship by 1.
description: Countess Doone is the sweet-talking belle of English Caribbean society. Her dark secret is that she was actually shipped to the Spanish Main as an Irish indentured servant. When her ship was attacked by pirates, she took advantage of the chaos to take the possessions and personality of a rich young lady who no longer "needed" them. She has spellbound the Jamaican royal court ever since.

name: David 'Bones' Wiley
ability: Once per turn, if this ship carries treasure and is within S of an enemy ship, you may randomly trade one treasure with that ship.
description: Wiley was raised and groomed for command by the dread pirate Rodriguez. When Rodriguez was killed in combat, Wiley was paralyzed by his new post. So he carved two dice out of Rodriguez's skull, allowing his mentor to guide him even in death.

name: El Acorazado
ability: Two hits from the same shoot action are required to eliminate one of this ship's masts.
description: The captain of "The Battleship," pride of the Spanish fleet and perhaps the strongest ship ever built, claims that not even the devil himself could sink her. The mysterious pirate El Fantasma, however, may soon test that boast.

name: El Ballista
ability: On the turn this ship is pinned, eliminate one crew from the enemy ship.
description: Under Spain's control, the El Ballista was considered unbeatable, but Jack Hawkins won her without firing a shot. He wanted to name her the Sea Nymph in honor of his female accomplices, but his crew decided to keep the name and lose Hawkins instead.

name: El Chico
ability: Spanish ships get +1 to their cannon rolls against this ship.
description: The Boy," formally the El Gregorio, was a member of the armada that guarded the annual treasure fleet from Tierra Firma to Spain. Her capitan, Oro Navarro, sold the fleet's location to Blackheart, and no Spaniard will rest until Navarro and his crew are dead.

name: El Corazon del Mar
ability: If derelict, this ship gains a base move of S.
description: The crew of "The Heart of the Sea" certainly live up to their ship's name: They put their hearts and backs into anything they do.

name: El Dorado
ability: You own any derelict this ship explores; both ships become docked at your home island.
description: "The Gilded One" was known as the San Salvador before David "Bones" Wylie won her on a lucky die roll. His crew's talents complement his luck, with several qualified captains among them.

name: El Duque
ability: If this ship has a Captain crew, she gets +1 to her cannon rolls.
description: "The Duke" was once the largest Spanish ship permanently stationed in the Caribbean. Even though there are now larger ships in the area, the El Duque is still the fleet's flagship by virtue of her exceptional crew.

name: El Fantasma
ability: This ship may dock at an enemy home island and load one treasure. If able, she must leave on your next turn.
description: Sailing into and out of the mists, El Fantasma uses stealth as his major weapon. None know for sure whether he and his crew are even human — they seem to appear and disappear at will and are almost impossible to hit with cannons.

name: El Garante
ability: This ship gets +1 to her cannon rolls for every friendly ship within S of her.
description: This is the capital ship of the Armada de Barlavento—the special fleet assigned to rid the Spanish Main of pirates. "The Guarantor" is often under the command of Almirante del Nero, who oversees his crew's competition with the El Acorazado.

name: El Ladron
ability: When this ship sinks another ship, you may repair one of this ship's masts.
description: "The Thief" is mastered by Robert Fagan, a London street urchin who leveraged a life of petty crime into one of piracy. Fagan remembers his poor days well, ordering his crew to strip targets of every scrap before letting them sink.

name: El Leon
ability: Ramming cannot eliminate this ship's masts.
description: The capitán of "The Lion" relies on his ship's incredibly strong hull and his crew's bloodthirsty nature. In combat, he favors closing in quickly and then sending boarding parties.

name: El Picador
ability: No ability
description: "The Bullfighter" was named after the story of a famous matador who went to sea after losing his leg in the arena. His spirit is said to inhabit this ship, bringing much courage to her crew.

name: El Tirador
ability: Once per turn when this ship hits an enemy ship, also eliminate one crew from that ship.
description: Comandante Antonio de Silva personally trained the marines on "The Gunner" to pick off enemy crew from long range. The ship has thus become famous for leaving her opponents "headless."

name: Explorer
ability: This ship may dock and explore a wild island using the same move action.

name: Fernando Sanchez
ability: This ship may dock at an enemy home island and load one treasure. If able, she must leave on your next turn.
description: Sanchez uses information smuggled to him by Nemesio Diaz to raid enemy ports when they are most laden with gold. Sanchez has put a price on Hawkins' head for tricking his galleon onto a reef, and he's doubled that price for Hawkins' monkey, Skyme. His expensive hatred of the monkey remains unexplained.

name: Fidel Zuan
ability: This ship gets +1 to her cannon rolls against Spanish ships.
description: Fidel Zuan loves his brother, Gaspar. He reminded himself of that every day he rotted in a Spanish prison. After finally freeing him, his brother "explained" that Fidel had been falsely accused and wrongfully imprisoned. Fidel now fights the Spanish like the devil himself.

name: Forged Papers
ability: This ship gains the Explorer special ability.

name: Freedom
ability: This ship may dock at an enemy home island and load one treasure. If able, she must leave on your next turn.
description: The Freedom's Captain James avoids stand-up fights. As he says, "Cannons are indiscriminate: They might hurt me — not just my crew!" Sneaking into port and stealing is much more his style.

name: Gaspar Zuan
ability: Place this crew face up during setup. Reduce the cost of all other crew placed on this ship by 1.
description: Gaspar was given the El Picador by Spain to hunt English pirates, and his brother Fidel was kept hostage to ensure his return. But Gaspar betrayed them both by attacking the Spanish treasure fleet. Gaspar can talk anyone into joining him, even his brother. One day his lies will catch up with him, but that day is not today.

name: Genny Gallows
ability: One of this ship's treasures is worth +2 gold when she docks at your home island.
description: Captain Gallows has hated England since the day she watched her father's neck stretched. She will attack any ship, but relishes hurting England the most. Her crew would follow her to the gates of hell, both because of her leadership and her connections on the Spanish Main.

name: Genny's Red Rampage
ability: This ship gets +1 to her boarding rolls.
description: Genny Gallows' crew have been known to kill each other for the right to wear cloth torn from the curtains of the Red Curtain bordello, which signifies membership in the Red Rampage boarding party. Rumor is that the banshees who survive a tour are treated to a night at the Red Curtain.

name: Ghost Crew
ability: This ship's crew cannot be eliminated unless she sinks.
description: Some say the Ghost Crew are damned men cursed to sail these waters until they send enough souls to hell to get theirs back. Others say that El Fantasma and his crew are human, just tricky enough to terrify their opponents before they fire the first shot.

name: Gonzalo Mora
ability: When this ship hits another ship, you choose which mast is eliminated.
description: Capitàn Mora is a shark who prefers surgical strikes to the blundering tactics of the English. His instincts about the weak spot of a fleet or ship are amazing, allowing his gunners to do more damage with a single shot than other crews might do with several broadsides.

name: Governor Lynch
ability: This ship gets +1 to her cannon rolls against Pirate ships.
description: Lynch hates pirates with a passion that defies reason. He despises Morgan for being a pirate and Myngs and Modyford for sullying the crown of England by associating with them. He often leads his fleets in pirate-hunting expeditions.

name: Greyhound
ability: When this ship carries no cargo, she gets +S to her base move.
description: No crew trims sails like this ship's, and when her hull is empty she sprints like her namesake. Her accurate fore and aft guns were made by WeaponmMaster Charles Southwyn.

name: Harbinger
ability: You own any derelict this ship explores; both ships become docked at your home island.
description: The very sight of the black sails of Blackheart's flagship has caused ships to strike their colors and surrender.

name: Helmsman
ability: This ship gets +S to her basic move.

name: Helmsman
ability: This ship gets +S to her basic move.

name: Helmsman
ability: This ship gets +S to her basic move.

name: HMS Albion
ability: If derelict, this ship gains a base move of S.
description: HMS Albion is an excellent scouting sloop. She especially shines in slow waters, sailing circles around more bulky vessels.

name: HMS Belle of Exeter
ability: This ship's cannons may not be eliminated (masts still may be). If derelict, she cannot shoot.
description: "Ironsides Exeter," as she is known to many in the Caribbean, has plate iron surrounding all her gun decks. This makes her cannons almost impossible to destroy, but her speed and cargo capacity suffer as a result.

name: HMS Birkenhead
ability: This ship gets +1 to her boarding rolls.
description: HMS Birkenhead was part of several of Sir Myngs' insertions into Spanish ports. It was outfitted with spikes and guillotine lines to aid in the repelling of boarding parties.

name: HMS Bolingbroke
ability: Other ships do not block this ship's line of fire.
description: Captain McGrath is not the most flamboyant of commanders, but his gun crew is among the best on the Spanish Main thanks to his endless training.

name: HMS Dover
ability: No ability
description: HMS Dover is the standard of Her Majesty's Navy. She is large, well armed, has above-average cargo capacity, and is capable of reasonable speed.

name: HMS Europa
ability: Once per turn, roll a d6. On a 5 or 6, this ship may be given an extra action
description: The crew of the sloop HMS Europa live in fear that Commander Temple will again come aboard on a scouting mission.

name: HMS Gallowglass
ability: When this ship sinks another ship, you may repair one of this ship's masts.
description: HMS Gallowglass is manned by many ex-cons, including several "Bones" Wylie's crew. These men can strip valuables from sinking ships and barely get their feet wet.

name: HMS King Edward
ability: If this ship has a Captain crew, she gets +1 to her cannon rolls.
description: HMS King Edward, the most modern English ship in the Caribbean, is often the flagship of larger naval actions. When a senior officer is on board, her crew excels—especially her gun crew.

name: HMS Leicester
ability: This ship eliminates two masts with one hit.
description: HMS Leicester is currently the English fleet's most effective gunship. She features batteries of a new cannon type designed by Weapon-master Charles Southwyn.

name: HMS Lord Algernon
ability: This ship ignores the first hit she takes each turn as long as she has all of her masts.
description: HMS Lord Algernon is constructed of double-planked American colonial hardwood, making her slow but almost cannon proof. She has come to the Spanish Main to support attacks on Spanish interests.

name: HMS Lord Walpole
ability: When this ship hits another ship, you choose which mast is eliminated.
description: HMS Lord Walpole's gun crew was personally trained by Thomas Gunn, so suffice it to say they are good shots.

name: HMS Meresman
ability: You may double the range of this ship's cannons each turn, but you must roll a 6 to hit.
description: The guns of HMS Meresman have the longest range on the Spanish Main.

name: HMS Oxley
ability: This ship eliminates two masts with one hit.
description: HMS Oxley features heavy cannons that can splinter an enemy mast in a single broadside. The downside is that the guns are too heavy for the crew to maneuver quickly, reducing accuracy.

name: HMS Plantagenet
ability: This ship gets +1 to her cannon rolls against Pirate ships.
description: HMS Plantagenet is a small, mercurial ship able to sail in shallow waters and up streams. This pirate hunter is manned exclusively by men who have lost everything to pirates.

name: HMS Titan
ability: Once per turn, roll a d6. On a 5 or 6, this ship may be given an extra action
description: HMS Titan, the largest English ship on the Spanish Main, is the only ship that has ever wounded the mysterious Revenant. Admiral Lord Battonbrig commands the Titan with iron discipline.

name: HMS Wycliffe
ability: Ramming cannot eliminate this ship's masts.
description: HMS Wycliffe was constructed in the shipyards of Boston of incredibly strong American hardwoods. It is said that she can withstand being rammed by any ship on the Spanish Main.

name: Homemade Flag
ability: All cannon ranges are reduced to S, when attacking this ship

name: Joaquin Vega
ability: This ship ignores the first hit she takes each turn as long as she has all of her masts.
description: Joaquin Vega is a master blacksmith. His swords rival those of Castile, and his ship armor is unparalleled the world over.

name: L'Aguila
ability: When touching a Pirate ship, this ship may load as much of that ship's treasure as she can carry.
description: Under Capitán Alarico Castro, "The Eagle" has earned a fearsome reputation. Castro's crew has perfected the art of ransacking and destroying their pirate enemies. It is rumored that he keeps a portion of the spoils hidden from Spain.

name: La Furia
ability: This ship eliminates two masts with one hit.
description: Although "The Fury" was outfitted with the same cannons as the Asesino de la Nave, she does not perform as well at short range, a fact that can be attributed only to the quality of her gun crew.

name: La Joya del Sol
ability: This ship gets +1 to her boarding rolls.
description: An imposing armed merchant ship, "The Jewel of the Sun" can move quickly with a large cargo. Built by a consortium of merchants, she was outfitted with decent guns, but her crew is trained in little other than repelling boarders.

name: La Repulsa
ability: This ship gets +1 to her cannon rolls for every friendly ship within S of her.
description: "The Repulse" is a small but effective scout sloop. The confidence and performance of her small crew dramatically improve when she is part of a larger force.

name: La Resolucion
ability: Once per turn, this ship may randomly take one treasure from any ship she touches.
description: Capitan Alberto Ladran was sent from the Castilian court in disgrace, his commission as capitan the only recognition of his years of royal service. He now uses the La Resolucian to prepare for his triumphant return to the royal court.

name: La Santa Teresa
ability: L range cannons cannot hit this ship.
description: The crew of the Santa Teresa believe that their sloop is blessed by Teresa herself, for their luck has never run out.

name: Longshanks
ability: This ship may never load the last treasure from an island.
description: Although they are excellent gunners, the crew of the Longshanks do not coordinate well on any other tasks, including the gathering of treasure.

name: Lucky the Parrot
ability: Once per turn, this ship may look at one face-down cargo on any ship.
description: Bones often has Lucky fly to a ship to see what she holds. When Lucky returns, it uses its claws to "roll" dice into a stein, determining if the ship will be spared or pursued. Potential victims know that to shoot at Lucky would result in Wiley killing them and everyone they've ever met, so they leave their fate to the dice.

name: Lynch's Noose
ability: This ship gets +1 to her boarding rolls.
description: The Noose is a special unit of the King's Marines that specializes in the bloody business of boarding actions. These men are the most loyal to Governor Lynch and his quest to rid the Caribbean of pirates.

name: Marksman's Map
ability: Once per turn, this ship may look at one face-down cargo on any island.

name: Master Bianco
ability: This ship gets +1 cargo spaces. This crew takes up no cargo space.
description: This quiet, unassuming man is in demand for his unrivaled cargo-packing efficiency. But only Capitàn Castro knows that Bianco always packs away something extra for himself. Bianco knows that Castro will one day require payment for his secrecy.

name: Master Gunner Rogelio Vazquez
ability: All of this ship's cannons have L range.
description: Vazquez can hit a wine glass with a cannonball at 500 yards. He secretly desires to own a weapon made by the master himself, Charles Southwyn, so he searches through every treasure haul, looking for items made by the English legend.

name: Muerta de la Corona
ability: This ship gets +1 to her cannon rolls against Spanish ships.
description: "Death to the Crown" was so named by Gaspar Zuan to appease his brother's bloodlust for the throne of Spain.

name: Musketeer
ability: This ship gains one 3S cannon that may not have its range or cannon roll increased. It can shoot from any mast (even an eliminated mast).

name: Musketeer
ability: This ship gains one 3S cannon that may not have its range or cannon roll increased. It can shoot from any mast (even an eliminated mast).

name: Musketeer
ability: This ship gains one 3S cannon that may not have its range or cannon roll increased. It can shoot from any mast (even an eliminated mast).

name: Myngs Marauders
ability: Other ships do not block this ship's line of fire.
description: Myngs' most-trusted men have been with him since he was captain of the 52-gun Marston Moor. They are well trained and have deadly aim.

name: Nemesio Diaz
ability: Once per turn, cancel the ability of one crew or ship within S of this ship.
description: Nemesio Diaz (aka William Cob, Jean Parisot la Valette, and Michel van Horn) is a true son of Spain, but he spends most of his time spying on the aristocracy of Spain's enemies. He works to defeat any who would plunder the riches that are Spain's by papal decree; that is, all of the Americas.

name: Oarsman
ability: If derelict, this ship gains a base move of S. This crew takes up no cargo space.

name: Pandora
ability: This ship gets +1 to her boarding rolls.
description: Mastered by the mysterious and beautiful Crimson Angel, the Pandora spreads death and destruction. Unlike the evils spread by the mythological relic, however, Crimson Angel's plunderings are capricious: Some ships suffer only theft, while others are wiped out.

name: Pescados de Plata
ability: Once per turn, this ship may move S after unloading cargo.
description: The "Silver Fish" is fast and agile. Her crews are all ex-merchant sailors, and so they are expert cargo handlers

name: Plague
ability: All crew on this ship are removed. When this ship touches any other ship,  pass this treasure to that ship and the crew on that ship are now removed. While in possesion of the scurvy treasure this ship cannot dock.

name: Powder Pete
ability: One of this ship's treasures is worth +1 gold when she docks at your home island.
description: Pete is Carbon Charlie's right-hand man—mostly because he caused Charlie to lose his right arm! Powder Pete knows how to turn cannons into gold and, when they have it, gold into more gold.

name: Raven's Neck
ability: Once per turn, this ship may look at one face-down treasure on any island.
description: The tall crows nests of the Raven's Neck provide excellent vantage points for the spotting of treasure and targets.

name: Revenant
ability: Other ships do not block this ship's line of fire.
description: The Revenant ("one who returns after death") is an appropriate name for the mysterious flagship of Capitan El Fantasma and his ghostly crew.

name: Revenge
ability: This ship gets +1 to her cannon rolls against English ships.
description: The Revenge was known as HMS Sedgewick before she was liberated by Genny Gallows, who gave the ship a new purpose: sending the English to their maker.

name: Royal Fortune
ability: Spanish crew may use their abilities on this ship.
description: The Royal Fortune seeks to deliver what her name implies. Manned by both buccaneers and ex-Spanish sailors, she preys on the royal fleets of all nations.

name: Rum
ability: Do not give this ship an action the turn after loading rum.  Rum is worth gold equal to 6 minus the number of crew aboard this ship when rum was loaded.

name: Sea Nymph
ability: If derelict, this ship gains a base move of S.
description: After Captain Jack Hawkins was "asked" to leave the Ballista, he worked his way back to prominence by taking the El Gama Larga, which he renamed the Sea Nymph as an insult to his former crew.

name: Shadow
ability: This ship may dock at an enemy home island and load one treasure. If able, she must leave on your next turn.
description: Taking the El Aquilino—now renamed the Shadow—launched Calico Cat into prominence. How she managed to take such a large ship is still a mystery, but the Cat now has more firepower in her quest for revenge.

name: Shipping Charts
ability: Once per turn, this ship may look at one face-down cargo on any ship.

name: Shipwright
ability: This ship may repair at sea or at any island.

name: Shipwright
ability: This ship may repair at sea or at any island.

name: Shipwright
ability: This ship may repair at sea or at any island.

name: Silver Dagger
ability: This ship gets +L to her base move if she has all of her masts
description: The Silver Dagger was taken from the Dutch near the island of St. Barts. She is swift when undamaged, but slothful when wounded. To prevent being slowed, she has excellent cannons stolen from the Spanish

name: Silverback
ability: L range cannons cannot hit this ship.
description: Captain Luc de Card won the Silverback in a card game. Ironically, he later lost the French warship when he bet three kings against a full house. He remarked ruefully that he should have known better than to depend on kings, of all people.

name: Sir Christopher Myngs
ability: Once per turn before you give this ship an action, roll a d6. On a 5 or 6, this ship may be given the same action twice.
description: Myngs was sent to the Spanish Main to remove the Spanish. As usual, however, he wasn't given enough ships to do the job, so he pioneered the English-buccaneer fleet. He personally led the largest of these fleets against the Spanish and Dutch.

name: Skyme the Monkey
ability: Once per turn, this ship may randomly take one treasure from any ship she touches.
description: Lady Arcadia de Sol gifted this monkey to Jack after he saved her from Blackheart. Jack renamed him Skyme in honor of his old partner, but wishes that he hadn't: The monkey seems to have picked up some of Blackheart's more evil mannerisms.

name: Snipe
ability: L range cannons cannot hit this ship.
description: The Snipe is a fast and agile sloop whose speed is her best defense. Jack Hawkins used the Snipe to capture the Sea Nymph.

name: The Darkhawk II
ability: This ship's base move becomes S when she reaches her cargo limit.
description: The El Pàjaro Relleno was Master Bianco's favorite ship before she was captured. He once said, "Given time, I could hide most of Spain in her enormous hold."

name: The Recreant
ability: Once per turn when this ship hits an enemy ship, also eliminate one crew from that ship.
description: Sailed by a crew of buccaneers who became sharpshooters while hunting illegal game, the Recreant prefers to first eliminate enemy officers in a fight to reduce her prey's effectiveness.

name: Thomas Gunn the Elder
ability: This ship gets +1 to her cannon rolls against Spanish ships.
description: Gunn's family was sailing to Jamaica when the Spanish warship El Tirãn attacked. His wife was killed, and Capitàn de Alva took Gunn's 18-year-old daughter, Catherine, hostage. Gunn sold his soul to the navy for ransom money, but Spain denies any knowledge of her.

name: Thomas Gunn the Younger
ability: This ship may move and shoot using the same move action, plus. Once per turn when this ship hits an enemy ship, also eliminate one crew from that ship.
description: Gunn became a marine in His Majesty's Navy to seek revenge on the Spanish for his mother's death and sister's abduction, and he becomes more convinced every day that pirates deserve to die. His marksmanship is famous on the Main, as is his pension for keeping to himself.

name: Treachery
ability: English ships get +1 to their cannon rolls against this ship.
description: The Treachery earned her name and the eternal hatred of Her Majesty's Navy when she "guided" the fleet over a reef that splintered their hulls. Her crew later returned and looted the wrecked ships.

name: Venture
ability: This ship sinks when her last mast is eliminated.
description: Nothing ventured, nothing gained. The Venture carries more gunpowder than she should in order to double pack her guns for better range. But that makes her a potential fireworks display.

name: Windjammer
ability: Forts cannot shoot at this ship.
description: The Windjammer's nimble nature makes her a tough target, but at the cost of reduced firepower.

name: Zephyr
ability: This ship gets +1 to her boarding rolls.
description: The Zephyr was the sloop that Calico Cat stole from Havana. Her crew is made up of the most deadly fighters Havana's slums have ever produced.
